Key Match Events: Stephen Curry scored 27 points to lead the Warriors to a 118-112 victory over the Celtics.
Buddy Hield contributed 16 points for the Warriors.
Andrew Wiggins also added 16 points for Golden State.
Jayson Tatum led Boston with 32 points.
Derrick White had 26 points and six rebounds for the Celtics.
Draymond Green hit a free throw with 11 seconds left to extend the Warriors' lead.
Kyle Anderson sealed the game with two free throws with 2.4 seconds to play.
Kevon Looney made a crucial put-back layup after Curry's driving layup was partially blocked.
Buddy Hield connected on a right-wing 3-pointer, giving Golden State a seven-point edge with 46.3 seconds left.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Warriors coach Steve Kerr was booed by the TD Garden crowd due to his use of Tatum at the Paris Olympics.
The Warriors scored 52 points in the paint compared to Boston's 36.
Boston forward Jaylen Brown missed his third straight game with a strained left hip flexor.
Warriors guard Brandin Podziemski was out with an illness.
